intro: Kinostemon ornatus f. subintegrifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved kinostemon, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its distinctive foliage. It features narrow, elongated leaves that are mostly entire, with only minor serrations along the edges. The plant belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes many aromatic and ornamental species. Its botanical structure includes small, clustered inflorescences that produce tiny, white to pale pink flowers. This subspecies is typically found in specific microhabitats, often in shaded, moist environments within its native range.
